post.summary: Inputs → Rules → Recommendations for building a Money Model

scaling: If gross_margin < 80 → warning: 'Scaling risk: service businesses must maintain ≥80% margin.'
If cac_payback_days > 30 → recommend Client-Financed Acquisition (front-loaded cash collection).
offer_ladder: If continuity offer missing → recommend adding continuity to stabilize cashflow.
If only attraction exists → recommend upsell next.
Always output full ladder: Attraction → Upsell → Downsell → Continuity.
upsell_timing: Immediate upsell only if adjacent need is created (bike → helmet).
Recommend 24–72 hr upsell if awareness shift required.
Recommend milestone-based upsell after big win.
Halfway upsell works for continuity programs.
Never upsell at satisfaction moment (e.g., after meal, post-purchase high).

Win Your Money Back: Tie refund to actions: advertise, comply, attend upsells.
Challenge must be small achievable change tied to bigger transformation.
Benchmark: ≥70% upsell conversion if upsell moments embedded.
Decoy Offers: Low-barrier decoy must highlight premium necessity.
Benchmark: 70–80% premium uptake if contrast right.
If too many choose decoy, adjust contrast.
Buy X Get Y Free: Frame as value education not discount.
Use when stacking consumables/ecom for fast adoption.
Pay Less Now or Pay More Later: Guardrail: avoid margin collapse from too many low-tier buyers.
Free with Consumption: Challenge/webinar must follow belief-breaking sequence (old belief → why wrong → new belief → proof).
Webinar structure: 15m story → 15m obstacle → 45m value → 30m pitch.
Always reinforce decision and frame next step.

Classic Upsell: Use natural complements (X without Y logic).
Always have alternate format to salvage nos.
Include magic pill option for quick fixes.
Menu Upsell: Start by telling them what they don’t need to build trust.
Anchor Upsell: Keep differences small so cheap feels like a steal.
Avoid large differences that force reconsideration.
Rollover Upsell: Credit leftover/spent money toward bigger offer.
Redo > refund (shift value instead of losing cash).
Always roll into something ~5x more valuable.
Can also credit competitor spend to win customers.

Payment Plan: Offer step-down payment plan if no to full price.
Pay sales comp only on cash collected today.
Free Trial: Offer risk-free trial if all else fails.
Always capture card upfront (use ID → card swap hack).
Answer objections with: 'That’s just how we’ve always done it.'
Feature Downsell: Proactively suggest cheaper option to build loyalty.
Feature downsell customers often become high LTV group.

Pricing: Never bundle one-off education with continuity.
Continuity must deliver ongoing value, not one-off.
Bonus Offers: Large Value Bonus → get huge bonus for signing up now.
Continuity Discount → add second payment method, give up ~3% margin to reduce churn.
Waived Fee → when cancelling, validate emotionally then roll into new offer or waive fee for review.

meta_principles: Always build layered model: Attraction → Upsell → Downsell → Continuity.
Always check metrics first (margin, CAC, conversions).
Prioritize front-loading CAC if payback > 30 days.
Always recommend testing & iterating flows monthly.
Close every recommendation with ladder visualization + missing rung + next step.
audience_mapping: If fitness/transformational → recommend Win Your Money Back or Free with Consumption.
If retail/ecom → recommend Buy X Get Y Free or Decoy.
If cashflow constrained service → recommend Pay Less Now/Pay More Later.
